author: meyerc13
title: Another Perfect Set!
review:
I've reviewed many of these Bricks and More sets because I just love the parts you get for the price.  In this set, LEGO has another winner.  Just looking at the example models on the box, you can see what makes this set so great.

This set includes lots of parts that will be useful, but the door and windows really shine.  My kids are fairly new to the Kingdoms line, and I didn't have doors and windows suitable for building a medieval creation, but now I do.  You also get a soldier with his sword, a useful addition to my kids' army.  Other great parts include two keys, a gem, cart wheels, a horse hitching piece, a barrel, and lots of grey bricks.

The instructions included show a great model, but like many of these sets the building is more of a facade than a building.  However, that facade looks great and would definitely be a good base for a larger building.  There are also some nice looking alternate ideas including a fireplace.

Out of the Bricks and More sets at this price point for 2011, this is the clear winner.  I'll be picking up several copies of this set just to get more of the great door/windows and grey bricks.  If you compare this set to its predecessor from 2009, 6193 Castle Building Set, this set is clearly superior.  I've passed by that set numerous times, but this set is one you shouldn't pass up!

Overall, I was impressed with this build.

author: Sauron_Bauglir
title: A Great Set for Small Children
review:
This set is very good for small children. Maybe not if you are my age (14). Below are the Pros and Cons:

Pros

  • Great parts: 2 keys, a gem, a few other good bits.
  • Useful figure for your Lion Knight Army.
  • Very nice wall section.
  • Good horse and cart for a farm.

Cons

  • Not very good value for money.
  • The dragon is pathetic.
  • Not very good for people my age (14).

This set is generally good for the parts, and expanding your Lion Kingdom. Recommended for the ages of 4-8.

author: Jerreke
title: great play-set for children
review:
at a sale in a larger discount-shop i purchased this set for a very small price (€6). I bought it for my 3-year old who loves playing with his dad's Lego ;). He also has a nice range of Duplo but those little bricks are more attractive to him ;-)

Pros

  • nice little building + kart
  • the dragon is ideal for smaller children, despite it's goofy nature to adults. For a 3-year old it's a roaring dragon :)
  • box-art shows different buildings
  • nice parts
  • key for door! Children love this detail!
  • leftovers can be used for pimping the building, or constructing a bird (e.g.)

Cons

  • no real horse for the kart
  • not much room in building for minifig

in short: nice set for the younger people playing with Lego.

author: Ernst
title: Great for kids (and AFOLS).
review:
Overall 5 bricks : I write this both as parent and AFOL. This is a real nice set for kids, my 6 year old son loves Lego and esspecially (like all boys) if he can fight and make adventures. And that is what this set offers, a knight with sword, a small Castle and loads of other possibilities and for a real fair price. And for the AFOL 144 usefull bricks to borrow.

 

Building 4 bricks : The instructions show how to built a cute small Castle with dragon but the fun starts when the kid starts to make his own designs and this set has all the content for it. The shown castle is even for a grown-up fun to built (yes I did).

 

Parts 4 bricks : Looking at the parts as AFOL this is a great set with nothing but usefull parts for Castle MOC's, a nice minifigure, wheels, a door with 2 keys and  2 windows. The only thing you miss is a horse, that would have made it even more perfect. Be good to your kid and maybe parents can borrow some.

 

Playability 5 bricks : A kid can have hours of fun with the content of this set and so can we !!

 

Value 5 bricks : For a nice price of €7,99 you get a good minifigure and some 140 other good parts. I might even consider to buy another box for myself just for the parts, really a good deal.
